metadata.title: CVE-2021-31870 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in klibc before 2.0.9. Multiplication in thecalloc() function may result in an integer overflow and a subsequent heapbuffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-31870` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

klibc-utils - 2.0.7-1ubuntu5.1
libklibc - 2.0.7-1ubuntu5.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: klibc package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.7-1ubuntu5.1').
